data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding automatically
[ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding automatically
Added CCTouchAction which simulates touches as FiniteTimeAction
data.body:
This PR contains CCTouchAction which performs gestures such as Tap, Swipe, Pinch as FiniteTimeAction.
The main purpose of this module is to help writing UI test, and also it provides intuitive way to dispatch touch events as gesture.
The usage of this is exactly same as original CCActions.
I hope this feature suits cocos2d-x.

data.title: Allow to unbind asynchronous texture loading callback with a custom key.
data.body:
In order to unbind the callback passed to
`cocos2d::TextureCache::addImageAsync(path, callback)`, one has to
call `cocos2d::TextureCache::unbindImageAsync(path)`. In the cases
where the loading of the same texture is requested from several sources
simultaneously, then none of the source can unbind its own callback
unambiguously.

This commit adds an overload of the `addImageAsync` function taking an extra
argument identifying the callback, thus allowing to unbind it unambiguously
in cases where the loading of path is requested by several sources
simultaneously.

data.title: 游戏切换到后台，再切换回来动画累积的问题
data.body: cocos2d-js 写的h5 游戏切换到后台的时候服务器发了很多消息  等切换回来了 所有响应消息的动画都累积到一起显示了  这样应该怎么处理啊

data.title: Uniformize image support macro usage.
data.body:
All images format implementation but WIC test the value of a CC_USE_<FORMAT>
preprocessor macro to verify if the implementation must be available or not.
WIC support is checked against the definition of the macro only,
independently of its value, thus making the implementation available even
if CC_USE_WIC = 0.

This commit makes the tests of the CC_USE_WIC macro identical to the tests
of the other similar image format macros.

data.title: Widget::isClippingParentContainsPoint does'n works if widget is not touched or rendered
add etc2 CPU and GPU decode. (PVR fileformat only)
data.body:
add etc2 CPU and GPU decode. (PVR fileformat only)
original source code is KTX(Khronos).
optimize for KTX cpu decode.
etc2 GPU decode setting is add "-DCC_USE_OPENGLES=3" for compile option.
## ETC2 GPU decode

GPU decode of ETC2 requires OpenGLES3.

for example.

Xcode
Preprocessor Macros
“CC_USE_OPENGLES=3”

Android
Application.mk
“APP_CPPFLAGS := -DCC_USE_OPENGLES=3”

data.title: update cocos2d-x's version to 3.11
RenderTexture To RenderTexture (ping pong effect) artefacts
data.body:
Having troubles with render textures....
A previous issue of this kind was closed without being fixed... even in cocos 3
(actually i wonder if it could be hardware/drivers related)

just trying to copy one render texture to another one each frame.
frame 0: render a simple sprite to RTa (then dispose it, not used any more)
frame 1: RTa to RTb
frame 2: RTb to RTa
frame 3: RTa to RTb
frame 4: ...
till the end of times

Of course the interest (in case you wonder why i would do that) is to apply a specific shader between the RT copies to do really nice effects ... well known technique and a real pitty it's messed up in cocos :(

without applying any shaders or transforms ... here are my results ..

after 10 to 20 frames:
![img_0365](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1607568/12646950/3881fd5e-c5d3-11e5-83eb-16e13de26d3f.jpg)

after 50 to 60 frames
![img_0368](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1607568/12646997/6772c22e-c5d3-11e5-869c-2ed231cd3098.jpg)

Have you tried yourself this kind of effect before closing the issue ?

data.body:
- Should be const reference for data/string args to be written in FileUtils methods.
-  Better name for data to be saved.
- Remove unnecessary memory copy when saving string to file.

data.title: Allow inherit form FileUtilsLinux, FileUtilsWin32 and FileUtilsWinRT.
data.body:
The doc for FileUtils::setDelegate() says:

```
 * You can inherit from platform dependent implementation of FileUtils, such as FileUtilsAndroid,
 * and use this function to set delegate, then FileUtils will invoke delegate's implementation.
 * For example, your resources are encrypted, so you need to decrypt it after reading data from
 * resources, then you can implement all getXXX functions, and engine will invoke your own getXX
 * functions when reading data of resources.
```

But the constructor of  FileUtilsLinux, FileUtilsWin32 and FileUtilsWinRT are private.

So make these constructors protected which allows inherit from them.

---

BTW:

Why inheritance?
Why not something like `FileUtils::setCrypt(const Crypt& crypt)`.
After set, `Crypt::encrypt()` are called before save data/string to file.
and `Crypt::decrypt()` are called after read data/string from file.
If not set a Crypt to file utils, just do normal reading and writing.

data.title: [BUG] ccui.EditBox - Black Label When Editing Finished
data.body:
![7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5449223/12601879/be99f576-c4df-11e5-8255-6b8f2a61e229.png)
Version: cocos2d-x-3.7
Platform: android
Devices: Nexus 5, Huawei Nexus 6P
Issue: When editing finish (after enter clicked), label turns to black block. Sometimes, crashed directly.

After checking logcat, found that editBoxCallbackFunc (in file UIEditBoxImpl-android.cpp) used to refresh the text of the EditBox were invoked in different thread, neither in GL thread nor in UI thread when editing finished occasionally.

http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/bug-ccui-editbox-black-label-when-editing-finished/26520

data.title: Fixed subtle documentation issues
data.body: Just fixed some docs for better reading clarity

data.title: Fix warnings when building projects for iOS and tvOS
data.body:
When building `libcocos2d iOS` and `tvOS` on Xcode 7.2, I get the following warning:

```
Warning: no rule to process file 'cocos/base/CCStencilStateManager.hpp' of type sourcecode.cpp.h for architecture x86_64
```

Here's the setting that causes the issues:

![screen shot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4461792/12588577/99498dba-c49c-11e5-8035-2eacedc0297c.png)

The library project includes `CCStencilStateManager.hpp` under the compile sources section (`PBXSourceBuildPhase`),  but `.hpp` is the header file.

This patch fixes it, and thank you for your time.

data.title: Replace char* with std::string in HttpRequest
data.body:
This replaces the usage of `const char*` with `const std::string&` in `HttpRequest::setUrl()` and `setTag()` arguments, for the following reasons:
- Both `_url` and `_tag` members are `std::string` type.
- To avoid calling `std::string::c_str()` when passing arguments to them

Also, there are no backwards breaking changes to APIs. Thanks!

data.title: Remove obsolete Win32 references.
data.body: Remove references to files that no longer exist. Win32 cpp-tests was built to verify changes.

data.title: Crash when touch is ended after a button has been removed
data.body:
Cocos2d-x crashes in the following scenario:
- A button is added to the scene
- The user starts touching it (and holds)
- The button is removed from the scene
- The user releases the button

I've only actually tested this with menu items (not buttons). I'm using v3.9 and I get a BAD_ACCESS exception when the touch release happens. Shouldn't the event listener be cancelled when the button is removed from the scene?

data.title: anchorPoint position delimiters parsing in CocosStudio works wrong (MacOS X)
data.body:
Reproduce steps: (on MacOS X)
1. Set system language to Russian (or any other with delimiters - "," of fractional part of digit )
2. Open CocosStudio and create node with sprite and publish project.
Your sprite properties should look like that:
![2016-01-25 16 08 34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1148009/12551812/45e7b9cc-c37e-11e5-9452-38f4e351b772.png)
3. Look at size of csb-file/csd-file.
4. Set system language to English (or any other with delimiters - "." of fractional part of digit)
5. Open CocosStudio and publish project
Your sprite properties should look like that:
![screen shot 2016-01-25 at 16 11 58](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1148009/12551875/ca6b5064-c37e-11e5-89e3-94e1c9d8147d.png)
6. Compare sizes of published csd and csb files for "," delimiters and "."

Size should be different. And when you'll try to load that nodes into your game anchorPoints of sprite will be (0.f 0.f) for ","-version and (0.5f, 0.5f) for "."-version.
